Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen so today 
I am going to make a dish called tom yum hang or

that translates to dry Tom Yum and that might 
seem weird to you because many of you will know

tom has a soup so how can a soup be dry so this 
is basically a stir-fry version of that dish and

I was reminded of this dish because recently 
a Netflix documentary called street food did

an episode on Bangkok and they this is one of the 
dishes that they featured and I was like oh yeah

that's a really really good dish a really simple 
one almost faster than the soup version but still

has that same flavor that we all love and today 
we're gonna do a seafood version which is the

version that's featured in the documentary 
so we're going a little bit luxurious here

but you can definitely substitute with other 
proteins if you like alright let's get started

obviously this being a tummy I'm we're gonna do 
with our thumb yum Trinity or the three herbs

that you must have first one being lemongrass 
just gonna use the bottom half so this is the

whole lemongrass here I'm not using the top 
part because there's not as much flavor in it

you can save it for tea and for this you wanna 
cut off the bottom and then make really really

fine slices because we're gonna actually toss 
it into a stir-fry and you want to make the

pieces small enough that it's edible without 
being uncomfortable okay so really really thin

pieces you can't go too thin but you can go too 
thick now the lungo again for this we want to be

able to eat it so you want to make very very fine 
pieces so from a whole piece you make thin rounds

the longer can be quite tough especially 
if they're older so I'm gonna do yeah five

pieces is good and galangal especially it's 
a very intense strong flavor when you chew on

it and the piece is too big not pleasant like 
it's nice when it's infused gently but if you

get a big chunk of it it's it's a little strong 
so you want to make sure that your pieces are

really really small okay and in the lime leaves 
the kaffir lime leaves are the one thing that I

will leave in large pieces and then we'll just 
eat around it in the final dish because it's

nice to have like lots of big green pieces around 
because there's no other green anything in this

dish that's not true there's cilantro but still 
I want I want these big pieces and if you've got

question around kaffir lime leaves what it is how 
to use how to store I do have a video on like if

your lime leaves 101 I will link to that in the 
description below you can check that out say okay

I'm gonna go through the other ingredients really 
really quickly obviously you got fish sauce lime

juice super important for thumb yam now in my 
thumb yum soup video for our thumb Yum with

shrimp I usually add a Thai chilli paste also 
known sometimes as chili jam when I'm freaked

out however for this recipe I'm not gonna use 
that you can if you want to but it will become

like a really sort of full robust flavor I 
want something more light and refreshing so

I'm gonna omit that and instead use chopped palm 
sugar because that chili paste is quite sweet so

we're gonna do palm sugar instead and then I've 
also got quite a bit chilies here cuz I want a

lot of chili flavor but I did remove the seeds 
which is so not Thai of me it's very untied to

remove seeds out of chilies but for this I want a 
lot of chili flavor without the heat so I removed

the seeds and the pit you can leave it in by all 
means I've got some shimeji or beech mushrooms you

can do straw you can do oyster any sort of Asian 
mushrooms that don't have a lot of strong flavor

no shitake mushrooms and no button mushrooms are 
my only two conditions and tomatoes shallots and

then for a protein as I mentioned we're gonna do 
seafood and I am splurging on ginormous shrimp

scallops and squid and if you don't know how 
to prepare a clean and prep a whole squid I do

have a separate video for that for you I will 
link to it in the description below and also up

here so the first thing we're gonna do is sear 
off the seafood because this being seafood you

don't want to overcook them overcooked seafood 
is rubbery doesn't taste good especially squid

in Thailand most of the time people will just 
blanch them in boiling water which is a lot

easier and you can do but the flavor is better 
when you sear it so we're gonna do that and it

seems no matter how well I think I've dried my 
shrimp that they're always wet and continue to

splatter on me so you want to get this completely 
cooked and in the end we'll just toss them in with

everything and be done with it okay that is done 
add a little more oil if you need to I'm gonna

do the scallops next now the scallops you actually 
don't want to cook them well-done they're actually

better about medium with scallops you can sort 
of see the doneness is by looking at the side

to see like how white they're turning from the 
side and so you want to get it sort of like a

third of the way up before you flip them and the 
other side should have a beautiful sear on it

so now we can see that I still have a band in 
the middle that still sort of not done yet that's

exactly where I want them and then finally the 
squid squid turning the heat on would help with

squid if you're doing squid you want to cook 
them last because they release a lot of liquid

and so especially if you're doing a lot of squid 
you might end up with just a pool of liquid but

you have to get rid of so I like to do them last 
and then this way they're sort of picking up all

the flavor from the serum for the seared scallop 
and one thing with squid is most people overcook

them they take like literally 30 seconds to 
1 minute to cook before they become rubbery

okay oh I love that they're picking up that nice 
grill flavor okay so you're looking for the squish

to turn translucent at turn go home translate 
Franklin red blue steady to white and then if

you press on them they're firm their dun dun dun 
dun dun dun dun dun one of the worst things to

overcook is in fact good now depending on the 
state of your pan if you've got burnt bits on

the wok you may want to clean it but if it's not 
burnt but it's brown there's actually really good

flavor you want to keep so you don't have to 
clean it so I'm gonna keep mine because it's

not burnt but I'm gonna add my herbs off heat 
because that pans been really hot and I don't

want to burden my herbs prematurely so all the 
herbs go in the shallots are going in and the

chilies are gonna go in as well I'm gonna add a 
little more oil and now I'm gonna turn the heat

back on just medium heat for now you don't want 
to burn the herbs and you want to just give it

about 30 seconds just told the lemongrass and 
the galangal can infuse the flavors into the

oil and they really do not take that long to do 
that and now I'm gonna deglaze with some water

you can use chicken stock if you have some and 
that'll pick up any delicious mess left by the

seafood right into our sauce whoo look at that 
that just looks good already palm sugar or chili

paste if that's what you're using and some fish 
sauce and give this a stir to dissolve the sugar

so you want to make sure your sugar has top quite 
finely so you don't have to do this forever okay

so now I'm gonna go in with my mushrooms give it 
a quick toss gonna up the heat a little bit now

and then all my seafood can go in and I check 
to see how much liquids in this bowl if it's

not that much I just throw it all in for flavor 
but if there's like just a kind of liquid then

you don't want to turn this into a soup right 
so the seafoods already done so I am done and

turning this off I'm throwing in my tomatoes 
at the end and just using the residual heat

to stir and soften the tomatoes ever so gently 
and oh oh my god I almost forgot my lime juice

you want to go them with lime juice at the end 
because the less you cook lime juice the fresher

the flavor will be mmm look at that luxury dry 
tom yum beautiful for some greenery I'm gonna do

cilantro woohoo if you don't like cilantro you 
can do green onions oh there are chilies in the

air and that is it look how easy and quick that 
was very nice now you want a plate with a bit of

depth because there's a lot of delicious 
sauce on there that you want to maintain

yeah that is the good stuff my friends now I'm 
gonna have this with rice so let's take one

of everything a squid a scallop some tomatoes 
and some mushrooms this is one of those dishes

you can't get bored off because the flavors 
are just so fresh okay let's do scallops we

never eat scallops on hot I kitchen this is the 
first time we're splurging because we're fancy

like that let me tell you when you put five 
chilies even if you take out the seeds it's

still pretty spicy but it's just perfect mmm 
the scallops is perfectly done nice and tender

the sweetness from the scallop meat goes so well 
with that tart fresh flavor and the citrus aroma

of the earth this is such I don't know how to 
explain it it's flavorful but at the same time

it's light because we opted not to use the 
chili paste but if you want something sort

of heavier more robust definitely the chili 
paste would work I've done it both ways but

this is more like a summery dish it would 
be go great with like a glass of sparkling

something or other mmm so good I hope you give 
this a try you don't have to do all this fancy

seafood that I'm using you can just do all 
squid all shrimp or I suppose you could do a

chicken but it's probably not gonna taste quite 
like this another thing I want to mention too

is because we sear all the seafood in the pan I 
can really taste all the seafood juices in this

sauce like that sauce is like a nice seafood 
broth right there so if you were say lazy and

you just like blanch them it's not gonna be 
quite the same okay so just so you know so I

hope you give this a try their recipe as a weight
